intro: Ononis thomsonii var. glauca, commonly known as Thomson's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, whitish bloom, giving it a powdery appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
